alert.note: Alert for Marinette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 9:23PM CDT until further notice by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Green Bay WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near McAllister affecting Menominee and Marinette Counties. For the Menominee River...including Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, McAllister...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near McAllister. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Floodwaters are covering River Drive and Shore Drive west of Wallace in Menominee County, Michigan and South Park Road east of Porterfield in Marinette County. This stage compares to a flow of 24240 cubic feet per second at White Rapids Dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 17.5 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 07/05/1953. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
